verses.verse: "Can you draw <S%H4900><s%> out Leviathan <S%H3882><s%> with a fishhook <S%H2443><s%>? Or press <S%H8257><s%> down <S%H8257><s%> his tongue <S%H3956><s%> with a cord <S%H9112><s%>?
"Can you put <S%H7760><s%> a rope <S%H100><s%> in his nose <S%H639><s%>? Or pierce <S%H9344><s%> his jaw <S%H3895><s%> with a hook <S%H2336><s%>?
"Will he make <S%H7235><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> supplications <S%H8469><s%> to you? Or <S%H518><s%> will he speak <S%H1696><s%> to you soft <S%H7390><s%> words <S%H1697><s%>?
"Will he make <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with you? Will you take <S%H3947><s%> him for a servant <S%H5650><s%> forever <S%H5769><s%>?
"Will you play <S%H7832><s%> with him as with a bird <S%H6833><s%>? Or will you bind <S%H7194><s%> him for your maidens <S%H5291><s%>?
"Will the traders <S%H2271><s%> bargain <S%H3739><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> him? Will they divide <S%H2673><s%> him among <S%H996><s%> the merchants <S%H9212><s%>?
"Can you fill <S%H4390><s%> his skin <S%H5785><s%> with harpoons, <S%H7905><s%> Or his head <S%H7218><s%> with fishing <S%H1709><s%> spears <S%H9487><s%>?
"Lay <S%H7760><s%> your hand <S%H3709><s%> on him; Remember <S%H2142><s%> the battle; <S%H4421><s%> you will not do <S%H3254><s%> it again! <S%H3254><s%>
"Behold, <S%H2005><s%> your expectation <S%H8431><s%> is false; <S%H3576><s%> Will you be laid <S%H2904><s%> low <S%H2904><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> at the sight <S%H4758><s%> of him?
"No <S%H3808><s%> one is so fierce <S%H393><s%> that he dares to arouse <S%H5782><s%> him; Who <S%H4310><s%> then is he that can stand <S%H3320><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Me?
"Who <S%H4310><s%> has given <S%H6923><s%> to Me that I should repay <S%H9608><s%> [him?] [Whatever] is under <S%H8478><s%> the whole <S%H3605><s%> heaven <S%H8064><s%> is Mine.
"I will not keep <S%H2790><s%> silence <S%H2790><s%> concerning his limbs, <S%H905><s%> Or his mighty <S%H1369><s%> strength, <S%H1369><s%> or his orderly <S%H2433><s%> frame. <S%H6187><s%>
"Who <S%H4310><s%> can strip <S%H1540><s%> off <S%H1540><s%> his outer <S%H6440><s%> armor <S%H3830><s%>? Who <S%H4310><s%> can come <S%H935><s%> within his double <S%H3718><s%> mail <S%H7448><s%>?
"Who <S%H4310><s%> can open <S%H6605><s%> the doors <S%H1817><s%> of his face <S%H6440><s%>? Around <S%H5439><s%> his teeth <S%H8127><s%> there is terror. <S%H367><s%>
"[His] strong <S%H4651><s%> scales <S%H4043><s%> are [his] pride, <S%H1346><s%> Shut <S%H5462><s%> up [as with] a tight <S%H9495><s%> seal. <S%H2368><s%>
"One <S%H259><s%> is so near <S%H5066><s%> to another, <S%H259><s%> That no <S%H3808><s%> air <S%H7307><s%> can come <S%H935><s%> between <S%H996><s%> them.
"They are joined <S%H1692><s%> one <S%H376><s%> to another; <S%H251><s%> They clasp <S%H3920><s%> each <S%H376><s%> other and cannot <S%H3808><s%> be separated. <S%H6504><s%>
"His sneezes <S%H5846><s%> flash <S%H9096><s%> forth <S%H9096><s%> light, <S%H216><s%> And his eyes <S%H5869><s%> are like the eyelids <S%H6079><s%> of the morning. <S%H7837><s%>
"Out of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> go <S%H1980><s%> burning <S%H3940><s%> torches; <S%H3940><s%> Sparks <S%H3590><s%> of fire <S%H784><s%> leap <S%H4422><s%> forth. <S%H4422><s%>
"Out of his nostrils <S%H5156><s%> smoke <S%H6227><s%> goes <S%H3318><s%> forth, <S%H3318><s%> As [from] a boiling <S%H5301><s%> pot <S%H1731><s%> and [burning] rushes. <S%H100><s%>
"His breath <S%H5315><s%> kindles <S%H3857><s%> coals, <S%H1513><s%> And a flame <S%H3851><s%> goes <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> from his mouth. <S%H6310><s%>
"In his neck <S%H6677><s%> lodges <S%H3885><s%> strength, <S%H5797><s%> And dismay <S%H1670><s%> leaps <S%H1750><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him.
"The folds <S%H4651><s%> of his flesh <S%H1320><s%> are joined <S%H1692><s%> together, <S%H1692><s%> Firm <S%H3332><s%> on him and immovable. <S%H1077><s%> <S%H4131><s%>
"His heart <S%H3820><s%> is as hard <S%H3332><s%> as a stone; <S%H68><s%> Even as hard <S%H3332><s%> as a lower <S%H8482><s%> millstone. <S%H6400><s%>
"When <S%H4480><s%> he raises <S%H7613><s%> himself up, the mighty <S%H410><s%> fear; <S%H9076><s%> Because <S%H4480><s%> of the crashing <S%H7667><s%> they are bewildered. <S%H2398><s%>
"The sword <S%H2719><s%> that reaches <S%H5381><s%> him cannot <S%H1097><s%> avail; <S%H6965><s%> Nor <S%H1097><s%> the spear, <S%H2595><s%> the dart, <S%H9277><s%> or the javelin. <S%H9632><s%>
"He regards <S%H2803><s%> iron <S%H1270><s%> as straw, <S%H8401><s%> Bronze <S%H5154><s%> as rotten <S%H7539><s%> wood. <S%H6086><s%>
"The arrow <S%H1121><s%> cannot <S%H3808><s%> make him flee; <S%H1272><s%> Slingstones <S%H9521><s%> <S%H68><s%> are turned <S%H2015><s%> into stubble <S%H7179><s%> for him.
"Clubs <S%H8455><s%> are regarded <S%H2803><s%> as stubble; <S%H7179><s%> He laughs <S%H7832><s%> at the rattling <S%H7494><s%> of the javelin. <S%H3591><s%>
"His underparts <S%H8478><s%> are [like] sharp <S%H2303><s%> potsherds; <S%H2789><s%> He spreads <S%H7502><s%> out [like] a threshing <S%H9167><s%> sledge <S%H9167><s%> on the mire. <S%H2916><s%>
"He makes the depths <S%H4688><s%> boil <S%H7570><s%> like a pot; <S%H5518><s%> He makes <S%H7760><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> like a jar <S%H4841><s%> of ointment. <S%H4841><s%>
"Behind <S%H310><s%> him he makes a wake <S%H5410><s%> to shine; <S%H215><s%> One would think <S%H2803><s%> the deep <S%H8415><s%> to be gray-haired.
"Nothing <S%H369><s%> on earth <S%H6083><s%> is like <S%H9302><s%> him, One made <S%H6213><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> fear. <S%H2844><s%>
"He looks <S%H7200><s%> on everything <S%H3605><s%> that is high; <S%H1364><s%> He is king <S%H4428><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of pride. <S%H7830><s%>"
